extendedIngredients.name: cooked ham
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 ounces cooked ham, cut into 1/4-inch dice

extendedIngredients.name: dairy free margarine
extendedIngredients.originalString: 3 tablespoons dairy-free margarine cut into 4 to 6 pieces or 2 tablespoons olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: fresh mint
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup fresh mint, coarsely chopped, plus sprigs for garnish

extendedIngredients.name: fresh tarragon
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons fresh tarragon, coarsely chopped, plus sprigs for garnish

recipes.title: Spring Peas with Ham and Herbs
recipes.instructions: Bring a medium-sized saucepan of salted water to a boil over high heat. Add the peas and cook until tender, about 3 to 5 minutes depending on size of peas.Drain the peas, reserving 2 tablespoons cooking water. Return the peas and reserved cooking water to saucepan.Add the ham, margarine or oil, mint, and tarragon, stirring until everything is combined.Season with salt and pepper to taste.Transfer the peas with ham to a serving bowl, and garnish with mint and tarragon sprigs to serve, if desired.

steps.step: Bring a medium-sized saucepan of salted water to a boil over high heat.
Add the peas and cook until tender, about 3 to 5 minutes depending on size of peas.
Drain the peas, reserving 2 tablespoons cooking water. Return the peas and reserved cooking water to saucepan.
Add the ham, margarine or oil, mint, and tarragon, stirring until everything is combined.Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Transfer the peas with ham to a serving bowl, and garnish with mint and tarragon sprigs to serve, if desired.
